  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61925].
  {panel}

This prevents the plugin JS from loading, which means the plugin stops working entirely. This includes:
* The menu items in the 'More Actions' menu on the view issue page
* The menu items in the cog menu in the issue navigator
* The admin pages: Permission Helper and Notification Helper

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61922].
  {panel}

Just installed Field helper onto a brand new JIRA instance with 2 customfields.

The autocomplete correctly shows the field choices, but pressing *{{Enter}}* does not actually select the chosen field.  If I instead click on the field I want, it works fine.

tested with:
* Chrome Version 20.0.1132.47
* Firefox 13.0.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61901].
  {panel}

JIRA Admin Helper is bundled with JIRA 5.2.
I did a test upgrade from JIRA 5.2.6 to JIRA 6.0.5 and found a bug in JIRA Admin Helper. 

I had problems with the Assignee field and 'Where is my field' suggested that I should have a look at 'Permissions' and 'People'. In JIRA 6, the tab is now called Roles, not People, which made the link point to an error page saying that there are no page called 'People'.

I saw that JIRA Admin Helper is only supported for 5.2.11, but isn't it weird that a system plugin is not compatible when upgrading to a stable JIRA version? 
Is there more System Plugins which may be incompatible in JIRA 6.0.5?

Best regards
Christoffer Karlsson
fields.summary: 'Where is my field' links to 'People' instead if 'Roles'
Can not change jira logo, favicon and L&F
Realy Funny Message in German
Last week most active

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61896].
  {panel}

Problem:

 

When uses an statement like:

 

I don't want to

\{break}

the line

 

What we expect as a results it is exactly the same, although this is the results that we get:

I don't want to

\{break}

 

the line

 

JIRA jumps one line when there is a value between the curly braces, so we're not able to use it in the desired format. I believe that this happens due to the fact that curly braces are used to insert code pieces and format the text in JIRA

 

Expected:

 

To implement a feature on JIRA to escape the Curly braces to be able to use it in texts without breaking the line.
fields.summary: Curly Braces breaks the line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61895].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The {{Labels}} field can be hidden from a screen via the 'Hide' option in the Field Configuration, and removed from Screen(s) as per [Specifying field behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/specifying-field-behavior-802592555.html#Specifyingfieldbehavior-hidefield] and [Deleting a Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/defining-a-screen-802592587.html#Definingascreen-Configuringascreen'stabsandfields]. However, the {{Labels}} field is still accessible via _More_ > _Labels_.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow a field to be completely hidden from a screen if it's being removed from the Screen(s) and hidden via Field Configuration
h3. Workaround

To remove the {{Labels}} field from the _More_ menu, users may go to:
 # JIRA ADMINISTRATION > Add-ons
 # Manage Add-ons
 # Search for "System add-ons" by typing *Issue Operations Plugin*
 # Expand the add-on
 # Expand the *modules*
 # Disable *View Issue Ops Bar Labels Link*
 (on) Disabling module as per mentioned above will cause the {{Labels}} field to be removed from ALL issues.
fields.summary: The Labels field is still accessible via More menu even though it has been removed from a screen and hidden via Field Configuration
Order sprints by name using JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61893].
  {panel}

When priority is set on ticket, it is set as 'high', 'highest'...
When showing priority in columnar view, it is shown as colored arrows.


This may be saving space on screen, but as a user, it is forcing me to interpret colors.
I find it that it's extra efforts for me to translate these colors to priorities especially.

Priority is important field and should be displayed including TEXT instead of dropping text and just how colored arrows.  

Orange and Red are too close  for 'hightest priority' tckets to stand out
fields.summary: Ticket priority is shown as just arrows (words missing)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61891].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 15 August 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi Everyone,

Thank you for commenting and watching this post over the last few weeks. We have read your comments and recognise the inconvenience that this bug may have caused since its initial occurrence.
h4. What went wrong?

JIRA’s feature for exporting issues as an Excel file (.xls) works by creating an HTML file and saving it with an .xls suffix. Up until recently, this solution worked. However, a recent Microsoft Office security update ([Microsoft Security Bulletin MS16-088 - Critical|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms16-088.aspx]) now prevents these files from being opened if the user has a high security setting in place, as the change of the file extension is considered to be a security vulnerability.
h4. What are we doing about this?

We don't believe that our HTML-based Excel export option is the best solution anymore, however we appreciate that many of you have built processes around it and its immediate removal may disrupt your daily operations. The HTML-based Excel export option will, for now, remain in JIRA Cloud.

This feature will be removed for Server in JIRA 7.2.

+Our intention is to eventually deprecate the HTML-based Excel export option in JIRA Cloud also.+ We will announce this prior to the removal. In the meantime, +we will change the .xls suffix to .html to reinforce that it isn't a native Excel file, and to make it easier to open it in web browsers.+ The exported .html file will also still be readable in Excel, if you have configured your environment appropriately (e.g. [Plan Trusted Locations settings for Office 2010|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc179039(v=office.14).aspx]).

Recently, a new CSV-based Excel export option was released to JIRA Cloud, and will be in JIRA Server 7.2. +We recommend you switch to this export option in the long term.+
h4. Will we develop a native Excel export option?

We are unlikely to provide a native Excel export in the foreseeable future. Having said that, [there are many add-ons in the Atlassian Marketplace that provide this functionality|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=jira&category=&cost=&hosting=&marketingLabel=&q=Excel].

Thanks for your patience and understanding.

Kind Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
{panel}

h3. Summary
After a Microsoft update (described below) export Excel sheets can not be done. Excel opens up to a gray window.

Update 
{code}
***************
Security Update for Microsoft Excel 2010 (KB3115322) 64-Bit Edition
Installation date: ‎7/‎13/‎2016 10:28 PM
Installation status: Successful
Update type: Important
A security vulnerability exists in Microsoft Excel 2010 64-Bit Edition that could allow arbitrary code to run when a maliciously modified file is opened. This update resolves that vulnerability.
More information: 
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/3115322
Help and Support: 
http://support.microsoft.com/?LN=en-us
***************{code}

Windows update did an excel change for security issues.
When the MS update is applied the warning about invalid format is not present and it opens to the blank Excel window.
When the update is rolled back, the export works once again. A warning message "Invalid Extension.jpg" is thrown and the export opens up successfully.


h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.148.3
Microsoft Excel 2010
Microsoft Excel 2016 version 16.0.7070.2026

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export issues to Excel
# Open in Excel with the update applied

h3. Expected Results
xls is loaded successfully without warning or blank pages.

h3. Actual Results
Excel shows a gray page with update applied.
 
h3.Workaround
# Use other xls viewer applications.
# According to a customer, the security upgrade of Excel has a selected default that prevents the spreadsheet from loading the data. The following steps to uncheck the said default setting described at the attachment below solved 100% the issue for him:
[^Enable Excel Extracts from JIRA.docx] 

*(Please, see attachment)*
fields.summary: Exports search results to Excel result in empty sheets due to Microsoft update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61889].
  {panel}

Hi
Currently the Pie chart's "Total Issues" under Jira Dashboards by default is set up to order the "Total Issues" according to highest number of issues associated with the particular Status it belongs to e.g.:
Done             11
To Do            10
In Progress    5
on Hold          2

Is it possible to to configure /order the "Total Issues" to be displayed in sequence of the actual workflow statuses. e.g .:
To Do            10
In Progress    5
on Hold          2
Done             11
fields.summary: Option to order Jira pie chart according to the statuses on a specific workflow
XSS in /includes/decorators/global-translations.jsp
Project templates
Add Go Language in Code Block Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61884].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when user would like to move a sub-task to another parent task, they will be shown a screen where they can choose recent issues. 
If there's an Epic and Story with the same name, user will not be able to differentiate the Epic and Story because there's no issue icon shown in the selector screen.

 !Screenshot from 2016-07-14 21-25-03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add icons beside the issue in selector screen so user can differentiate Story and Epic.

h3. Workaround 

User will have to check the issue from Issue Navigator to identify which one of the issue is Epic and which one is Story.
fields.summary: Improve Moving Sub-Task from Parent Task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61883].

h3. Problem Definition
It would be great if was possible to trigger a post function based on a workflow trigger for example " Review started - Automatically transitions the issue when a related review is started in Crucible "


h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: Post Function based on Workflow Trigger
OSWorkflowManager.doWorkflowActionInsideTxn() should not store the issue
It should be possible to log work by end date.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61879].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Columns order changed by JIRA randomly for newly saved filter.
h3. Steps to reproduce:

1. Run an already saved filter
 2. Add new column and Save As with a new name.
 3. Make sure the columns set is "Filter" (not My Defaults nor System).
 4. Add a column.

Check attached video.
h3. Expected results:

The selected column gets added to the end.
h3. Actual results:

One of two things happens:
 1. The selected column is inserted in the middle, and some shifting /shuffling of other columns happens (e.g., the left half of columns get approximately swapped with the right half of columns.
 OR
 2. All other columns are removed, and only the added column remains.
fields.summary: Columns order changed by JIRA randomly for newly saved filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61878].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In the JIRA Mobile version, clicking on collapsed comments in JIRA to expand the individual comment does not respond. Confirmed on both Android and iOS.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud 1000.148.3 (not available in list of versions)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a JIRA issue, ensure there is a long comment that will be reduced to 1 line
# On your mobile device, navigate to that issue in your browser.
# You'll see you can expand the physical list of comments, but not the individual comments that have been cut down to 1 line.

h3. Expected Results
The comment should expand. I also expected to be able to click on the comment in order to edit it or take any action on it.

h3. Actual Results
Clicking has no effect, almost as if it's not a clickable area.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround other than reverting to JIRA iOS app, or changing to Desktop Mode
fields.summary: Individual collapsed comments cannot be expanded in mobile version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61875].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Summary|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

h3. Summary
 
The JQL query field "updated" and "updatedDate is a duplication within the Issue Navigator feature. Both query will produce the same result when queried. Would be great if this feature could be used more effectively and simplify the usage so that both behaves according nature of its name and the ultimate aim is to sanitise JIRA's Dates (make them consistent) across the product, plus simplify reporting.
 
h3. How to Replicate
 
# Go to Issue Navigator
# Switch to advanced navigation search using JQL
# Key in "updated >= 2016-07-13"
# Key in "updatedDate >= 2016-07-13" will get the same result as above ^
 
h3. Actual Result

* Both "updated >= 2016-07-13" and "updatedDate >= 2016-07-13" shows the Date and Time component on the Last Updated column.

h3. Expected Result

* "updated >= 2016-07-13" should show the Date and Time component
*  "updatedDate >= 2016-07-13" should on shows the Date component in the Last Updated column.

h3. Instance Details
 
* Any instance with JIRA are able to replicate the issue.
 
h3. Investigation Done
 
* queried "updated = 2016-07-13" and  "updatedDate = 2016-07-13" will produce the same result.
* Asked developers regarding this behaviour. As stated by them, SystemSearchConstants.UPDATE_DATE defines two clause names for the same field which are "updated" and "updatedDate". The duplication exists for consistency with createdDate and resolutionDate. Also mentioned that it is very difficult to remove JQL, as it ends up being stored in the database. E.g. when you save a filter, that JQL is then stored in the database.

h3. Suggestion

Segregate "updatedDate" with "updated" clause names from SystemSearchConstants.UPDATE_DATE as this would be consistent with the query field names and expecting the followings results:

# querying updatedDate JQL field will show the result of *Date only*, only looking at the date component and ignoring the time component.
# querying update JQL field will show the result of *Date AND Time*, In other words, would look at both components, the date and the time.

{panel}
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Issues Navigator JQL to query for date-time (using update) or date only (using updateDate)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61874].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Summary|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

h3. Summary

On JIRA Issues Navigator, we are unable to query the *exact* update/updateDate date to show result of one day, instead we would be required to specify *time range*. 


h3. How to Replicate
 
# Go to Issue Navigator.
# Switch to advanced navigation search using JQL.
# Key in "updated = 2016-07-13" and Enter <-- will not get any result.
# Key in "updated >= 2016-07-13 AND updated < 2016-07-14" and Enter <-- will get result within the specified range.

h3. Actual Results

* Key in "updated = 2016-07-13" will not generate any result


h3. Expectation

* Key in "updated = 2016-07-13" will generate list of result for this day.

h3. Workaround

* To show the result for one day, we'll need to query: "updated >= 2016-07-13 AND updated < 2016-07-14".

h3. Instance Details
 
* Any instance with JIRA are able to replicate the issue.
 
h3. Investigation Done
 
* Tested the query and no result are found if exact date are queried.
 
h3. Please Help With
 
* Changed the filter behavior to include the query for the exact date besides having to specify range of date. This will simplify the usage so that non technical/developers can understand.

{panel}
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Issues Navigator to query for exact day instead of time range

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61873].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When assigning a screen to the 'View' operation for an issue type, you are given the option to add or remove the description field from the field configuration. As 'Description' is not a field that can be hidden from 'View', only 'Create' and 'Edit', it can cause confusion for users who would like to remove Description from the issue view entirely.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove the 'Description' field from the field configuration of the 'View' operation for an issue type in a project.

h3. Expected Results

Description should be hidden from the issue view, or it shouldn't be a field option for the 'View' operation.

h3. Actual Results

Description will still be in the issue view.
fields.summary: Cannot hide Description from View Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61872].
  {panel}

Hello Atlassian,

If this is already a feature then please disregard, but it would be a nice ability to tie Atlasssian's online support documentation into the search resources of a companies JIRA/Confluence tools.  In order to allow for security compliance it could be a checkbox (default off) so that installations did not need to worry about the system attempting to fetch remote assets, but if this was not a concern it would be nice to not have to leave JIRA/Confluence to benefit from Atlassian documentation.

Regards,
Scott Gilliland
fields.summary: Confluence configuration option to tie Atlassian online help into local instance site search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61871].
  {panel}

h3. Description
When a issue is assigned to a user, the history tab record the user display name and username. However, when the user changed the username, JIRA issue history tab seems to still using the old username to record the users action.

h3. Step to reproduce
# Create a user(lets say 'test') and using the user, perform certain actions on any issue (like adding issue links, comments etc)
# Notice that the issue history tab shows changes made by this user 'test'.
# Now rename this user from administration console giving it a new username (say 'testabc').
# Now make some more changes to the issue using this renamed user.
# Now go to the history tab and notice that the old username 'test' is still being used. The new username 'testabc' is never used in the history tab.

h3. Suggestion
* Update the user's username from the old to the latest in history tab, or
* Remove IDs of the fields value in the history tab
fields.summary: Improvement to sync user's latest username in history tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61870].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:

Issue description with colon (: ) does not work in quick search. If the *colon* *:* is added to the search string, it works.
The Quick search does not work with numeric search.

h3. Environment:
JIRA 7.1.7
PostgresSQL
Version 51.0.2704.103 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to reproduce:

* Create a ticket with the description {{Test : ACIS2016-00359}}
* Go to the quicksearch textbox and look for *ACIS2016-00359* without the colon and it will throw the below error:
**  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.37.50.png|thumbnail! 
* However, if you search with the colon {{: ACIS2016-00359}}, it returns the expected result as below:
**  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.39.13.png|thumbnail! 

* Numeric search:
*  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 18.03.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* There is no workaround as such, the user needs to include the colon with the search or user JQL search instead.

h3. Observations:

* There is no issue with other special characters such as *(* . It works as documented (that is to escape it) or we can search without it and it returns the result
*  !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.42.52.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Colon (:) does not work in Quick search.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61869].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When setting a color for the links in the *Look and Feel* menu in JIRA the color defined is not applied for all links throughout the JIRA instance (notably the sidebar in the dashboard page). Gadgets are also impacted such as the *Projects* gadget which still displayed links as blue.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.148.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the *Look and Feel* menu, choose a different color from the default one for the *Link Color* and *Link Active Color*.

h3. Expected Results
Color Scheme is consistent throughout all JIRA and links are displayed with the correct color as per defined in the color scheme.

h3. Actual Results
Color scheme is not used for all links in JIRA such as in the dashboard sidebar and some gadgets like _Projects_.
 !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.26.36.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.26.49.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround currently.
fields.summary: Customizing Link Color via Customizing Color Schemes is inconsistent throughout JIRA
Bulk edit group members only displays the username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61867].
  {panel}

When reporting bugs/issues I need to copy data from query result set into Jira description. The output of my Google Big Query generates tabulators and by using this convenient tool you can easily convert the data to a table: 
http://excel2jira.bluurgh.com

Sample input
{noformat}
Row	f0_	event	id	data1	data2 
1	2016-07-10	event1	12345	demoA1	demoP2	 
2	2016-07-10	event2	7465875468734	demoA1	demoP2	 
3	2016-07-10	event3	8476573587	demoA1	demoP2	 
4	2016-07-10	event4	765723657	demoA1	demoP2	 
5	2016-07-10	event5	73572352856	demoA1	demoP2	 
{noformat}

Sample output
{noformat}
||Row||f0_||event||id||data1||data2||
|1|2016-07-10|event1|12345|demoA1|demoP2| |
|2|2016-07-10|event2|7465875468734|demoA1|demoP2| |
|3|2016-07-10|event3|8476573587|demoA1|demoP2| |
|4|2016-07-10|event4|765723657|demoA1|demoP2| |
|5|2016-07-10|event5|73572352856|demoA1|demoP2| |
{noformat}

The result then displays like:
||Row||f0_||event||id||data1||data2||
|1|2016-07-10|event1|12345|demoA1|demoP2| |
|2|2016-07-10|event2|7465875468734|demoA1|demoP2| |
|3|2016-07-10|event3|8476573587|demoA1|demoP2| |
|4|2016-07-10|event4|765723657|demoA1|demoP2| |
|5|2016-07-10|event5|73572352856|demoA1|demoP2| |

This would be an awesome feature to ad in the Toolbox / Markup helper in wiki editor toolbox
fields.summary: Add Tool to Convert data from Excel to JIra Table markup
Implement fallback 'Group Name Attribute'
CVE-2016-4318: XSS vulnerability in role name on /project/ViewDefaultProjectRoleActors.jspa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61858].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In some use cases, filtering algorithm of Activity Stream is not so intuitive.
Please see the steps to replicate the behavior.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install vanilla JIRA 7.1.x (I used JIRA 7.1.8 to reproduce)
# Create a dashboard
# Add an Activity Stream with following options
#* Filters : *Activity* is *Issue created*
#* Display Options: Limit to *10* items
# Create a Scrum software development project which is called "test"
# Import issues with using [^test.csv]
# Rebuild indexes for sure
# Check if the Activity Stream is shown as follows
!before_comment.png|thumbnail!
# Update *TEST-10* (e.g. Comment something on the issue)
# Check if the Activity Stream is shown as follows
!after_comment.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Even after updating TEST-10, Activity Stream should show the same information as [^before_comment.png].

h3. Actual Results

Activity Stream showed activities like  [^after_comment.png].
fields.summary: Filtering algorithm of Activity Stream is not intuitive
Add an easier way to bulk edit permission schemes on JIRA 7.1.x
Limit group picker to filter out desired groups
JQL query for "COMMENT" field with !~ is not working with multiple comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61853].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the JIRA Audit log does not register whenever issue type and issue type scheme is modified, deleted or created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Register on audit log any actions performed for issue type and issue type scheme.
fields.summary: Audit log should register Issue Type and Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61850].
  {panel}

We wanted to migrate our project to our own JIRA instance. The original JIRA was running 6.0.8 we wanted to move to the latest 7.x.

Created a back up, but during import it had version miss match.

Downloaded 6.0.8 hope that I can import the project there and upgrade to 7. Failed with a field error message. No detail what I should do, what is the error.

So decided use the Issue export button. Funny that you export issues into format, which your product doesn't support. Anyway I had a go with Excel. Generated 14mb size file. Import error: File larger than 10MB. Oh my gosh!!! It is 2016 and the file is larger than 10Mb.

Created another export dropping the tickets, which are closed. File size: 7mb. Let's start importing it at 12pm on Friday.
Stupid question about there is a field, which he doesn't know where to map, but until I don't map it to the summary field I cannot press Next. Wonder why the choice than. Hurray Import begins... There is 148 error or warning... no detail probably because your product has no idea as well that is why it is either error or warning. It is a thing.

Any way... progress bar moves slowly... 7pm time to go home! Progress bar is 28%... Maybe it finishes on the weekend? Come in to the office. 10 am. Progress bar is at 52%.

Nice. 7mb 48 hour still not completed. Could you please share me that algorithm because I just cannot figure out what kind of algorithm parse 50% of 7mb in 48 hour on intel core i8.

Any way. I believe it is safe to assume your product cannot import/export its own data?
fields.summary: JIRA migration process is a catastrophe

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61849].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA will only synchronize the entire user directory.

Use Case:
* JIRA is used as the central user server across Bitbucket Server and FishEye.
* Both applications are licensed for a subset of JIRA Users.

Business Reason:
This would allow large user sub-groups using multiple applications to be maintained easily within a central location (JIRA).
fields.summary: Allow specific user groups to be associated per application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61848].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , Replicon and Maximizer Application is not included in JIRA Importers plugin.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide both application to directly import to JIRA .
fields.summary: Import Data from Replicon and Maximizer Application to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61846].
  {panel}

Reduce the number of emails I get. Suggestions:

1. Allow users to choose to get emails in digest form, e.g. one every 24 hours.
2. Batch up multiple changes to a single issue, so any changes in a specific time window (e.g. 10 minutes) get a single email sent.
3. Allow users to customize what fields result in emails when those fields are changed.
fields.summary: JIRA emails are way too spammy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61845].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
If a transition is associated with a screen, when the screen pops up, it's not possible to review the information in the background screen (usually View Issue screen) any more. If one is not ready to transition the issue, he/she has to cancel the screen, review the information in the background screen, then click the transition button and fill in all the fields again. This is inconvenient.

h4. +Suggestion+
The pop-up screen should be made non-modal, so that users can move it out of the view of the background screen and work on both simultaneously.
  
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – Jul 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for filing, voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.
 
I understand the modal dialog here can be cumbersome. Generally, making it non-modal and/or draggable is a great suggestion. Currently we don't have any work scheduled on this and cannot provide an estimate on when an improvement would be delivered. We will be looking into how we can improve screen dialogs soon, including transition use cases.
 
Regards,
Daniel Franz
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
fields.summary: Pop-up screens should be non-modal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61844].
  {panel}

Many users in our group have the Autowatch feature enabled, to get informed about new issues being submitted.
The usage of jira increased a lot (which is good, i guess), which made the number of emails each user receives unmanagable in the daily email flood without mailfilters.
And here we are stuck a bit in writing mail filters which separate jira mails which are due to the autowatch feature, from those emails which are received because one is on the watch list of an issue or because an issue is assigned to the user.
usually i would expect to set the mail filter on the "To:" field in the header (autowatch would go to "watcher-mailinglist@foobar.baz" and watchlist and assignees go to "actual_user@bar.baz")
But any other scriptable distinguisher (e.g. topic having [autowatch]) would be fine as well.
fields.summary: make jira notification emails distinguishable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61843].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The Filter Results Gadget wraps test in long description fields and as a result text content can span multiple lines with long descriptions. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide additional functionality to control the gadget's layout such as wrap text option, or truncate text.

h3. Workaround
Workaround options include:
- Use a wider column layout for the dashboard. 
- Keep the filter results gadget columns to a minimum.
- Include a JavaScript in your JIRA Announcement banner that locates the affected strings through the JavaScript document object model, and truncate them using Javascript. 
- Use the [Gadget Development Guides|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/Gadget+Developer+Documentation] to implement a specialised gadget for your needs.
fields.summary: Create Filter Gadget Layout options to prevent text wrapping
JQL behavior for "not in" doesn't include empty list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61840].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
I want to be able to send the email updates to only the assignee or reporter or everyone in the watchers based on some sort of dropdown so I can control who gets the email updates from a bulk change. 

I have a need for an email for every issue I edit in a bulk change, but I want to control it so they only go the the assignee, not to the watchers and reporters.

You should have the ability to control your audience, if you are requesting updates on aged help desk tickets, the reporter doesn't want the email since they are not the one that needs to provide the update. The watchers don't care either since they would only want to read the update. The assignee needs to be notified. 


h3. Suggested Solution
fields.summary: Enhance JIRA Email control with Bulk Changes
Add a method in JIRA REST API to get all the labels associated to a project

 !image-2016-06-29-21-41-08-254.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61831].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If the system or user language is changed to Portuguese then date fields will stop working correctly.
The date picker will return the value {{08/Jul/16 4:00 PM}}, once you submit the form data the following error will be shown:
- {code}'08/Jul/16 4:00 PM' não é uma data válida. Por favor insira a data no seguinte formato: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a{code}

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.141.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Try starting a sprint
or
* Try logging work

h3. Expected Results
JIRA accepts the date format returned by the date picker

h3. Actual Results
{code}'08/Jul/16 4:00 PM' não é uma data válida. Por favor insira a data no seguinte formato: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a{code}
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Change the first letter of month to lower case ({{08/jul/16 4:00 PM}}) 

{panel:title=Note}
There is a Bug inside this Bug regarding this workaround. If you try to change the first letter of the January month you won't be allowed, as the settings will automatically revert to the original state. However, it works for any other month. 
See video below for more details
[^buginception.mov] 
{panel}
fields.summary: Date picker does not work correctly if the system language is Portuguese
Ability to sort "Fix Versions" by their name:
As a user of Jira Test Sessions, I'd like the ability to run/create a report on test sessions to show various data points so that we can analyze and perform capacity planning
As a user of the Jira Test Session Gadget, I'd like to be able to select one or more Assignees and Projects so that I can filter the Test Sessions that truly matter to my team

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61824].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In an URL custom field customer is not able to enter a path which contains backward slash, the escape character does not work in this case.
This becomes a problem for customer who uses this field for local file path in Windows, like :
{{file:///C:\Windows}} (normal Windows local path)
 or {{file:///\\Server\folder}} (UNC path)
(See the error in screenshot below)
 !2016-07-08_url_err.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add support for backward slash.
fields.summary: Add support for backward slash in URL field type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61823].
  {panel}

I'm used to create comments in JIRA about the different tasks discussed during a meeting.
I use a special tag to mark this comment
such as <SAL 160708>
it is very easy to retrieve the issues where I've a comment like that,
but in the list of issue it is not possible to show the comment with the given tag.

Can we do this report in some way?

Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61821].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*

When creating a new {{*Business > Task*}} project in JIRA 7.0.5 and 7.1.9, a new workflow is created for the project. However, if you look at the project's workflow done transition, you would notice that it contains 2 conditions which are actually duplicates of each other.

*Environment*

* Found in JIRA Software 7.0.5.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a new {{*business > task*}} project in JIRA 7.
# Go to {{*Admin > Issues > Workflows*}} page and select the workflow for the project created in step 1.
# Select the done transition and press conditions in the pop-up.
# In the condition page, you would notice that the conditions shown are the same.
#* {{_Only users with Resolve Issues permission can execute this transition_.}} 

*Expected Result*
JIRA should not duplicate conditions of workflows.
fields.summary: Duplicate Workflow Condition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61819].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Some gadgets require users to configure "Statistic Type" which consists of various fields available in JIRA (eg. Assignee, Fix Version, etc). When configuring this, the fields are not ordered alphabetically which makes it hard to locate some field especially if this is a long list
!order.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion
Sort this alphabetically

h3. Note
_Statistic Type_ is just one example. I'm not sure if there are other configurations behaving the same as well.
fields.summary: Order Gadgets Configuration Alphabetically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61812].
  {panel}

When using REST to gather the JIRA fields, the value from *searchable* will return true even when you choose *None* for the search template.

h3. How to reproduce
# Create a custom field (i.e Number Field)
# Click on Edit (from the cog item)
# Select _None_ for the Search Template
# Trigger a REST as {{http://JIRA_ADDRESS/rest/api/2/field}}

h3. Results
Searchable will be returned as *True* as:
{noformat}
        "id": "customfield_10400",
        "name": "Testttt",
        "custom": true,
        "orderable": true,
        "navigable": true,
        "searchable": true,
        "clauseNames": [
            "cf[10400]",
            "Testttt"
{noformat}
fields.summary: When using REST to gather the JIRA fields, the value from *searchable* will return true even when you choose *None* for the search template.
Improvement Suggestion for JIRA Excel Export
Add notifyUsers flag to issue update webhook data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61805].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When sending E-mails into JIRA Service Desk, which includes content of configuration files, JIRA will often render it in strange ways.

This is important for customers who's use-case involves supporting a technical product that might involve communicating technical information

h3. Suggested Solution
Attempt to identify if text within E-mails is coding syntax and automatically render it as such. 

h3. Workaround
- Edit the description and wrap the config file in the tag: {{\{noformat\}}} at the start and end of the syntax specific text as that should help show a more sensible format, or escape the syntax manually using back slashes. 
- Configure [field renderers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-renderers-802592570.html] to prevent JIRA styling the text as another workaround.
fields.summary: Smart Syntax detection for Incomming Service Desk E-mails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61804].
  {panel}

I found this from getsupport.atlassian.com.
Steps to reproduce:
- I search for 1st time and it returns 4 issues. E.g. https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PA-2123?jql=text%20~%20%22engage-436%22 
- I open a new tab and search 2nd time and it return 1 issue
- I go back to the previous tab, choose Tools > Bulk Change > All 4 issues
- The next screen is showing 1 issue only (which is the result of the 2nd search)

Expectation is the 4 issues (which is result from the 1st search) instead of 1 issue (result from the 2nd search)

The recorded video to reproduce: https://youtu.be/riHpMV11SdY
fields.summary: Bulk selection (bulk change) is wrong when 2nd search is performed in another tab/window

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61799].
  {panel}

Are there any plans to change the pricing format for service desk and core?
We currently have 24 staff, and are hiring 2 more, this means we would need to jump massively in cost to pay for Core, Service Desk and all other add-ons for an additional 25 people when we only need one.
At present, we are looking at other solutions if there is no choice on pricing as it is ridiculous to have to jump such a large number.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Jira pricing issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61797].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition

At this moment, when JIRA is running behind a proxy (IIS for example) then it is not possible for JIRA to communicate with itself using the base url and pass through the authentication.

h3. Suggested Solution
I would like to have a configurable url that JIRA can use to make a callback to itself.

Reference issue : [How to fix gadget titles showing as __MSG_gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget].
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I would like a configurable url that JIRA will use to communicate with itself

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61796].
  {panel}

h3. Environment needed.

* Have a few projects.
* Have different project categories configured.
* Have project roles configured.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to User Management: Click on the cog icon !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/157679812/Cog.png! > User Management
# Select a user and click on "View JIRA Project Roles", then "Edit Project Roles".
# Click on the Project Category role

h3. Expected Results

All projects under that category will have the role box checked.

h3. Actual Results

Only the category role box will be checked. 

!Screen Shot 2016-07-06 at 11.00.13.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

In some cases, when there are "Uncategorized Projects", clicking on a Uncategorized project role will work as expected

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Clicking a project category role no longer auto select all underlying projects.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61795].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA, Burndown Chart will list all the Number Field based custom field even if the custom field is not used by any issue from the project.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JIRA to only list all the number field which is used by the issues in the specific project.

h3. Workaround 

No workaround. User can choose to ignore the custom field option which is not used in the project.
fields.summary: Burndown Chart list all Number Field based custom field
Search button should work because there is no automatic start of search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61793].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
For ease of use, clients have requested a gadget that displays a list of links to pages in Confluence

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a new gadget that allows a user to create a list of links to display to users on the dashboard
 
h3. Workaround 
# Edit the [Introduction gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Gadgets+for+JIRA+applications] to use wiki markup to list the pages you'd like to link to
# Create a Confluence page and add the links there, and then use the [Confluence Page Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Page+Gadget] to display the links:
 !Screen Shot 2016-07-06 at 12.19.17.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create a new Confluence gadget for JIRA to show a list of links to Confluence pages
